column2: Americanist Pilgrimage
Go on an patriotic pilgrimage to the great Americanist holy cities: Boston, New York, Philadelphia, Washington, and Richmond.

The time has come for you to undertake an epic pilgrimage to the five great Americanist holy cities: Boston, New York, Philadelphia, Washington, and Richmond. \n\nBut first, you must prepare for the journey.
Pilgrimage Preparation
On second thought, now is a bad time to travel.
I need nothing beyond the clothes on my back.
I shall travel in a splendid carriage.
I will bring a retinue of bodyguards for protection.

In times gone by, Boston was known as a center of learning for its many universities and libraries. Some of the ancient tomes from these libraries have found their way into the private collections of patriotic Americanists. If you seek knowledge, surely Founder Adams and Founder Hancock will look favorably upon you as you visit the holy sites of the Hub.\n\nThe natives you see along the road are sporting their traditional red stockings.
Pilgrimage to Boston

The sprawling ruins of old New York explain why the ancients simply referred to it as The City. Even now you can feel the enormous power and wealth of the seat of the empire as you approach Manhattan, heart of the sleepless city. With the guidance of Founder Hamilton and Founder Jay, perhaps you can do your part for American prosperity.\n\nFrom the bank of the Hudson River, you see numerous merchant ships and barges of all sizes.
Pilgrimage to New York

As a child you learned that Philadelphia was the birthplace of America, where the founders met in brotherly love to form a great union of previously disparate states. You hope that the holy sites of Philadelphia will inspire you to emulate Founder Franklin and Founder Paine, whose words had the power to sway others in thought and deed.\n\nAlong the road, you see peddlers selling traditional pretzelled bread from their carts.
Pilgrimage to Philadelphia

Named and built in honor of Founder Washington and Founder Lincoln, several of the holy monuments of the capital of Columbia still stand as a testament to America's enduring glory. Even during the dark years when Washington is under the control of heathens, patriotic Americanists work diligently to preserve and protect the many sacred relics of the founders.\n\nDespite the patriots' best efforts, major portions of the old city have been reclaimed by swamps.
Pilgrimage to Washington

The river city is known for its history of patriotic military struggle, and today serves as a trade center for the rich agricultural lands of the south. You hope to stir within yourself the keen insight and courage of Founder Jefferson, Founder Madison, and Founder Henry.\n\nSoldiers from the region are known to demand either liberty or death if captured.
Pilgrimage to Richmond
Approach the city...
The holy city is already part of your demesne, so it is a simple matter to visit the sacred sites you know so well.
Relax at the familiar holy sites of your city.
Donate to the order that maintains the holy sites.
The holy city is ruled by [From.GetTitledFirstName], and even though you are part of the same realm it is customary for a noble to request [From.GetPossPronoun] permission to enter the city.

The holy city is ruled by [From.GetTitledFirstName], a foreign lord. Though [From.GetSubjectPronoun] shares your faith, it would be wise to be respectful as you request permission to visit [From.GetPossPronoun] city.
The holy city is ruled by [From.GetTitledFirstName], an infidel of the [From.Religion.GetName] faith. It may be difficult to get [From.GetPossPronoun] permission to continue your pilgrimage.
Make a formal request for access to the city.
Flatter the ruler of the city with honeyed words.
Request entrance in the name of the Founders.
Give an inspiring patriotic speech.
Present a gift of gold and jewels.
Slip a few coins into the right palms.
Forcefully demand that you be allowed to enter.
Enter the city in secret.
Carefully enter the city in secret.
You slip by the guards\n
You are noticed by the guards\n
The holy city is ruled by [From.GetTitledFirstName]. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] has previously granted you permission to visit the holy cities in [From.GetPossPronoun] demesne.
Inform the gatekeepers that I have arrived.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has requested your permission to travel through your demesne on [From.GetPossPronoun] [From.Religion.GetName] pilgrimage.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has come to your demesne on [From.GetPossPronoun] [From.Religion.GetName] pilgrimage, praising your wisdom and requesting access to your city.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] is requesting access to a holy city in your demesne as part of [From.GetPossPronoun] [From.Religion.GetName] pilgrimage. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] gives compelling patriotic reasons for you to accept.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has come to your demesne on [From.GetPossPronoun] [From.Religion.GetName] pilgrimage. As [From.GetSubjectPronoun] requests access to the city, [From.GetSubjectPronoun] speaks with such sincerity and passion it nearly brings a tear to your eye. It would surely be madness to turn away such an inspiring pilgrim!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has given you a gift of gold and jewels in exchange for permission to proceed on [From.GetPossPronoun] [From.Religion.GetName] pilgrimage through your demesne.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] seems to think the power of [From.GetPossPronoun] realm entitles [From.GetObjectPronoun] to make a pilgrimage to the [From.Religion.GetName] holy sites within your demesne.
Your agents have discovered [From.GetTitledFirstName] secretly visiting [From.Religion.GetName] holy sites in your demesne, without your permission! What should be done with [From.GetObjectPronoun]?
Personally act as host for [From.GetObjectPronoun].
Allow [From.GetObjectPronoun] entry.
Deny [From.GetObjectPronoun] entry.
Throw [From.GetObjectPronoun] in the dungeon!
Kill that insolent fool!
Allowed Pilgrimage
Denied Pilgrimage

[From.GetTitledFirstName] graciously invites you into the city. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] hosts you in [From.GetPossPronoun] own great hall, and provides an honor guard to accompany you to the holy sites.
I had a wonderful time with my new friend.
My faith has been strengthened, and I must spread it.
Bring me the dice and wine, I'll tell war stories!
Perhaps the faith of my host can be swayed.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has been informed of your presence in the city, and [From.GetSubjectPronoun] grants you permission to enter the city and visit any of the holy sites.
There is always more to learn from the Founders.
A group of guardsmen stop you. Your presence seems to have offended [From.GetTitledFirstName], and [From.GetSubjectPronoun] has decided not to let you visit the holy sites of the city.
This isn't over.
I am [This.GetTitle], I go where I please.
Several members of the local garrison attempt to drag you to the dungeons! Surely [From.GetTitledFirstName] is to blame.
Your vassals will view this as tyrannical.\n\n
I'll go quietly.
You'll never take me alive!
You escape to plot revenge\n\n
I always have a plan.
Men-at-arms block your path with blades drawn.\n\n"In the name of [From.GetTitledFirstName], we'll take your head now..."
Not without a fight!
Defend me, men!
You make your way secretly past the city walls, and visit the important holy sites. You see a few other fellow pilgrims, and try not to draw attention to yourself.
Secret patriotism is the purest form.
I should talk to my fellow pilgrims.
I will acquire a sacred relic to take with me.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] of Boston has violated sacred law by refusing me entrance during my pilgrimage. By ancient rights, I may now claim the city if I choose.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] of New York has violated sacred law by refusing me entrance during my pilgrimage. By ancient rights, I may now claim the city if I choose.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] of Philadelphia has violated sacred law by refusing me entrance during my pilgrimage. By ancient rights, I may now claim the city if I choose.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] of Washington has violated sacred law by refusing me entrance during my pilgrimage. By ancient rights, I may now claim the city if I choose.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] of Richmond has violated sacred law by refusing me entrance during my pilgrimage. By ancient rights, I may now claim the city if I choose.
The city will be mine!
I must swallow my pride.
You had a great time with [From.GetTitledFirstName], and are proud to call [From.GetObjectPronoun] your friend.
Good.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] becomes your friend\n\n
You and [From.GetTitledFirstName] are at each others' throats, and [From.GetSubjectPronoun] is now your rival.
I will crush [From.GetObjectPronoun].
[From.GetTitledFirstName] becomes your rival\n\n
You were unable to complete the difficult journey of the pilgrimage. Perhaps someday you can attempt the pilgrimage again, and wash away the stain of failure.
Failed Pilgrimage
I have shamed my dynasty.
You return home from your pilgrimage, weary from the road but wiser for the journey. The friends you have made and the experience you have gained will surely aid you in the coming years.
Successful Pilgrimage
A still more glorious dawn awaits!
Successful Pilgrimages
Hurricane!

Messengers report that a massive hurricane has made landfall several days ago near [From.County.GetName], devastating much of the nearby coastline! It will be months before everything is back to normal.
My lands are unaffected.
Hurricane!
A hurricane has struck your county of [Root.GetName]!
Characters in this county must fend for themselves\n\n
Characters in this county are well protected\n\n
Hurricane Damage
High winds and flooding have damaged many buildings in this county.
Flooded Farmland
Floods have wiped out much of the harvest for this year.
Ruined Roads
Roads and bridges in this county have been badly damaged by a recent storm.
Damaged Trade Post
The merchant docks and warehouses have been damaged and looted.
Protector in the Storm
You responded well when a hurricane struck, and kept everyone safe.
Opportunist
You were noticed taking advantage of a disaster.
I think I can keep everybody safe.
Keep the roads clear, protect those close to me.
Focus on aiding the common folk.
Have your men plunder under cover of the storm.
No need to worry, let the storm come!
The sky grows black over the ocean as a massive storm approaches. The wind blows at gale force. Torrential rains flood the streets and fields.\n\n[This.Location.GetName] is a dangerous place to be!
Hurricane strikes [This.Location.GetName]
I might not be up to the challenge.
I'll try to stay alive.
Fortunately I have the ability to protect myself.

The sky grows black over the ocean as a massive storm approaches. The wind blows at gale force. Torrential rains flood the streets and fields.\n\nFortunately, you are well protected in [This.Location.GetName].
I'll be fine.
Do my part to aid those in need.
May [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] protect those out in the storm.
Prey on the unprepared.
After a disaster, there are often unscrupulous men who wish to take advantage of the chaos. With damage from recent events, bandits are beginning to appear in [Root.GetName].
Nothing can be done.
Put a bounty on them.
Kill the leaders, put their heads on pikes.
The Big One!

A massive earthquake has struck [From.GetName]! The ground shifts and shakes, threatening to reduce every castle and cottage to a pile of smouldering rubble. Minor tremors are fairly common in [From.GetName], but an earth-shifting convulsion this powerful occurs only once in a generation.\n\nThe debris-strewn streets are full of corpses pinned beneath broken masonry. The moaning wounded stagger among the wreckage, attempting to rescue their kin. A bloody madman is screaming that the end is near, that we'll see Armageddon soon.
Structures in [From.GetName] are built to withstand this.
This option is available because local laws require sturdy building construction.\n
The fortifications must be repaired.
Focus on fire-fighting efforts in the cities.
The common folk of [From.GetName] come first.
Run, [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] must be angry!

An earthquake has struck [From.GetName]! The ground rumbles and shakes, threatening to damage poorly constructed buildings. Stained-glass windows crack, loose objects are scattered across the floor, and livestock are spooked by the motion of the Earth.\n\nWell, it could have been worse...

An aftershock has struck [From.GetName]! Once again the ground rumbles and shakes, further damaging poorly constructed buildings. The wrath of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] is disrupting the repair work!\n\nWhen will this end?

Fires in [This.GetName] are out of control! In the chaotic aftermath of the earthquake, broken lanterns and embers scattered from cooking fires started numerous small fires in the most densely populated areas. Important buildings are at risk of being completely destroyed!
Hire a huge bucket brigade!
Nothing can be done.
Earthquake Damage
An earthquake has dealt widespread damage to buildings and roads in this province.
Collapsed Fortifications
An earthquake has collapsed castle walls and other fortifications in this province.
Fire Damage
Fire has damaged fields and wooden buildings in this province.
Building Code
Strict building codes make structures in this province more resistant to damage from earthquakes.
Survived the Big One
This character bore personal witness to a once-in-a-generation earthquake... and survived.

Your subjects in [From.GetName] are calling for you to do something to protect them from future earthquakes. Codifying construction methods that produce sturdier buildings seems like a good first step.
Building codes for the whole realm.
Building codes for my demesne.
Building codes for [From.GetName].
I don't need no stinkin' codes.
The Ground Shakes!

The Big One arrives in [FromFrom.GetName] with a distant rumble that rattles loose objects from tables. The quake quickly escalates into a roar as the Earth gallops under your feet, throwing you to the ground and filling the air with dust and debris. You feel a bitter rush of adrenaline, knowing that this moment could be your last...
The Earth in [FromFrom.GetName] quakes beneath your feet, scattering loose objects across the floor. You brace yourself against a sturdy wall and attempt to ride out the tremor.

Guilds of masons and carpenters in [Root.GetName] are petitioning for you to repeal the current building codes. The codes were put into place in the aftermath of an earthquake, but the guild representative claims the codes are onerous and costly.
Perhaps a few coins could change my mind...
Yes, these codes are antiquated.
No, safety of my people comes first.

Large groups of the common folk in [This.GetName] are worshipping within a ruin emblazoned with the trefoil icon of the Atomicist faith. Some claim that anyone who receives the Blessing of the Atom will be able to wield great power.
Atomicist Revival
A surge of popularity of the Atomicist faith is underway in this province.
They should be encouraged.
Investigate this heresy personally.
Send [Root.Holder.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] to investigate.
Let the peasants have their faith.
Your agents report that bands of Atomicists have been spotted in [Root.GetName], attempting to spread their faith. Their zealotry appears to spring from the Atomicist Revival in [From.GetName].
Expel the infidels from my lands with military force.
Drive the infidels out, in the name of [Root.Holder.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
They make some good points.

At the Atomicist Revival in [Root.GetName] you bear witness to the true power of the old world. You can sense it even now... the warm, thrumming energy of the Mighty Atom. You feel the seductive desire to harness its power and wield the sizzling, searing tools of the gods themselves. The spirits of this world seek to contain it for themselves, but with study and persistence you can defeat them.\n\nPerhaps with the right words, the right rituals, the right propitiations...
Atomicist Revival!
I will claim the power!
If you are a vassal, your liege will react\n\n
I will not turn away from my faith!
I will nip this heresy in the bud!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you with zealous Atomicist fervor in [From.GetPossPronoun] eyes. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] attempts to convert you, claiming that [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] is simply a manifestation of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]'s power.
[From.GetSubjectPronounCap] made some good points.
I will not turn away from my faith!
I will convince [From.GetObjectPronoun] to return to the fold..
To the dungeons with you!
Glorious power awaits!

You have abandoned your old religious practices, and embraced the awesome potency of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. Will this lead you to power and glory, or see you fall into ruin at the hands of hostile infidels?
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] be praised!

Your Atomicist zeal seems to have swayed the mind of your liege. [From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided it would be wise to abandon [From.GetPossPronoun] old faith and join you in dedicating [From.GetPossPronoun] life to unshackling the atomic spirits of the old world.
Praise [This.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has not taken kindly to your Atomicist conversion. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] sees you as a misguided infidel, rather than as a prophet revealing the truth about [This.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
This is bad...

[Root.Holder.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from the Atomicist Revival in [From.From.GetName]. [From.GetPossPronounCap] theological skill has allowed him to resist the allure of the Atom, and swiftly put an end to the heresy.
Good work.

[Root.Holder.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from the Atomicist Revival in [From.From.GetName], having resisted the seductive power of the Atom. Unfortunately, the Atomicist agitation will take some time to die down.
We did what we could.
You just had a [GetFromRelation], therefore it's up to you to decide whether to grant [From.GetObjectPronoun] the Blessing of the Atom.
The sacred tradition must continue.
I grant [From.GetFirstName] the blessing I never had.
[From.GetFirstName] will not suffer that foul ritual.
You just had a [GetFromRelation], therefore your spouse will decide whether to grant [From.GetObjectPronoun] the Blessing of the Atom.
Your [GetFromRelation] has decided to grant the Blessing of the Atom to your newborn child.
Your [GetFromRelation] has decided to deny your newborn child the Blessing of the Atom.
Blessing of the Atom

You are brought to the chamber of blessings. The priest removes the sacred totems of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] from a heavy metal reliquary. She touches each relic to the associated part of your body: forehead, sternum, palm, groin, and heel. \n\nThe metal is warm against your skin, and you feel a pleasant tingling sensation.

You are brought to the chamber of blessings. The priest removes the sacred totems of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] from a heavy metal reliquary. She touches each relic to the associated part of your body: forehead, sternum, palm, groin, and heel. \n\nThe metal is warm against your skin... in fact, it's searing hot. You feel nauseous and an unpleasant burning sensation creeps through your body.

Your [GetFromRelation] is brought to the chamber of blessings. The priest removes the sacred totems of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] from a heavy metal reliquary. She touches each relic to the associated part of the infant's body: forehead, sternum, palm, groin, and heel. \n\n[From.GetFirstName] gurgles happily. The ritual has gone well.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] be praised!

Your [GetFromRelation] is brought to the chamber of blessings. The priest removes the sacred totems of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] from a heavy metal reliquary. She touches each relic to the associated part of the infant's body: forehead, sternum, palm, groin, and heel. \n\n[From.GetFirstName] begins to cry, and is screaming before the ritual is over. You see a red mark on [From.GetPossPronoun] skin, and can only hope the injury is minor.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] has not been kind.
Blessing of the Atom
This character has received the Blessing of the Atom.
Cursed by the Atom
This character exhibited a strong negative reaction when receiving the Blessing of the Atom as a child.
Denied the Atom
This character was denied the Blessing of the Atom by their parents.
Firearmed
In possession of a functioning pre-calamity firearm. This trait has been deprecated in favor of artifacts.
Calculator
In possession of a functioning pre-calamity mechanical calculating device. This trait has been deprecated in favor of artifacts.
Timekeeper
In possession of a functioning pre-calamity clockwork timekeeper. This trait has been deprecated in favor of artifacts.
Typewriter
In possession of a functioning pre-calamity mechanical lettering device. This trait has been deprecated in favor of artifacts.
Far-Seer
In possession of a functioning pre-calamity portable telescope. This trait has been deprecated in favor of artifacts.
Bookman
In possession of several intact pre-calamity academic books. This trait has been deprecated in favor of artifacts.
Salvage Expedition
The techpriests need a constant supply of salvaged Old World technology to continue their studies, and a lucky salvager might find himself wielding a powerful tech prize.
Salvage Expedition

The people of the Old World left many amazing artifacts behind. Powerful weapons, tools that aid in all varieties of work, machinery our most brilliant Techpriests do not fully understand, and beautiful objects our finest artisans cannot replicate. Much of the Old World is gone, consumed by centuries of rust, but a few rare artifacts survive in workable condition...\n\nAcquiring such an artifact will not only bring me wealth and prestige, it is the sacred duty of all followers of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
Hmmm, where will I find good salvage?

You check the maps, and have located several potential expedition sites in the province of [From.GetName]. The people of [From.GetName] follow the [From.Religion.GetName] faith, and are culturally [From.Culture.GetName].\n\nProvinces populated by infidels are more likely to contain items of the Old World, since they do not have the traditions of salvage.
That will be my destination.
That province is unacceptable.
Before leaving on your Salvage Expedition to [From.GetName], it would be wise to make preparations.
Set out with your men.
Consult the Techpriests for good salvage locations.
Assemble a battle-hardened warband to accompany you.
Send envoys ahead to smooth your travels.
Unfriendly Locals

You arrive in [From.GetName], and many of the local residents are distrustful or outright hostile towards you and your men. You notice them watching you surreptitiously and talking amongst themselves, and have a difficult time finding a place to rest.
Ignore them.
We're well armed, they won't risk attacking us.
My envoys have arranged for safe passage.
Try to keep a low profile.

Rust Cultists from a nearby realm are attempting to salvage Old World artifacts from your lands in [Root.GetName]. Their presence seems to be drawing the ire of the local [Root.Religion.GetName] population, who are preparing for a confrontation with them.
Let the locals drive them away.
We must avoid bloodshed.

Mixed among the local residents in [From.GetName], you see the occasional soldier wearing the colors of [From.Holder.GetTitledFirstName]. Fortunately, the soldiers seem to be ensuring that order is maintained and the locals allow you to pass without conflict.
Hostile Locals

Your continued presence in [From.GetName] has drawn the ire of the local peasantry, and you are now confronted by a disorganized mob of angry villagers. They may not be well armed, and they're certainly not well trained...\n\n...but there are a lot of them.
We should turn back.
Your Salvage Expedition is over.
Your Salvage Expedition continues.
We can fight our way through!
They'll back down from a vulgar display of power!
Peasants like silver, right?
Driven from [From.From.GetName]
Hordes of angry local villagers have driven you from their lands, ending your Salvage Expedition. If it makes you feel better, tell yourself you left to avoid shedding THEIR blood.
Competing Salvager
During your expedition to [From.GetName], you encounter an agent of an unknown lord who shares your faith. He appears to be scouting new salvage sites for his master, in direct competition with you!
May the best salvager win!
Direct him to a promising site nearby.
Make him disappear.
Collapse!

You hoped the wooden reinforcement beams would be enough, but one of them slipped. The centuries have not been kind to the crumbling concrete and rusty iron, and the whole unstable mess is coming down around you!
Run for it!
I won't let debris stand in my way!
I planned for this risk.
Recent Salvage
This character has recently gone on a Salvage Expedition.
Preparing Expedition
This character is preparing to go on a Salvage Expedition.
Salvage in [From.GetName]
Your expedition has turned up very little valuable salvage. You have explored many ruined buildings, and everywhere you look you find the ruins picked clean.
Disappointing.
Someone has been here before me...
There is another site nearby we could check.

Your expedition has turned up a few items of useful salvage. In the ruined buildings and tunnels you have uncovered several artifacts of the Old World, though you have not yet found the kind of major prize you were hoping for.
At least I found something.
Hawk these trinkets, I know of another site.

Your men have discovered a large metal box beneath the ruins of a long-forgotten structure in [From.GetName]. The strongbox is corroded but still intact. Who knows what mysteries or treasures of the Old World are sealed within it?
I'll know soon, crack it open!
Have your tinker open it carefully.
Salvage

You have found scraps of Old World artifacts, but none of them are especially well preserved. There are objects that may have once been used for cooking or as craftsmen's tools, but it's hard to tell with the corrosion and decay of the centuries. They might be worth a few gold pieces to the right buyer.

Your men have discovered a cache of corroded coins from the Old World. Their coins were inexplicably made out of base metals rather than gold or silver, dramatically reducing their value as working currency. Still, they might be worth a few gold pieces.

You have discovered a long-hidden supply of Old World glassware. Unlike iron objects which have mostly been consumed by rust, many glass objects have survived. You need but wipe off the centuries and you'll have finely polished Old World artifacts that artisans today cannot replicate.

Amongst a wreck of disintegrated iron, you find a fabulously preserved piece of Old World machinery. Though stained with rust, the beautiful object itself does not seem to have rusted. It is about three feet across, irregularly shaped, with a half-dozen holes perfectly cut partway through it. It is constructed from a metal that is lighter than iron.\n\nThis will be a great addition to your great hall, or part of a shrine.

You have found a long-abandoned pair of old-world glasses. Although they at first appear to be coated in dust, further inspection reveals that the glasses are tinted. Although the frame is somewhat rusted, the lenses themselves are in good condition. With some work, they could be used to create fully-functional and stylish shades.

Your men take to the box with hammers, and succeed in ripping the door off after a few hours. Whether it was the rough handling of the box, the ravages of time and moisture, or simple bad luck, you find nothing of value within.
Treasures!

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a variety of Old World jewelery, glittering with gold, silver, and precious stones. The craftsmanship is finer and more intricate than what modern goldsmiths can produce.
Papers?

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: several old folios bound with crumbling dark leather and stacks of identical green paper strips with the rune "20" in the corners. It's amazing how well the safe has preserved its contents, the seal must have been perfect. The folios are filled with line after line of numbers and symbols.\n\nYou would be rich, if paper currency were still in use.
Ancient portraits of the Founders!
Icons of the Almighty Dollar!
Paintings?

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a collection of dozens of tiny paintings, discolored with age but extremely detailed. The paintings depict a family of people in the Old World. How these paintings were produced is a mystery to you, as the canvas is very thin and there are no visible brush strokes.\n\nThe cracked and crumbling condition of the paintings makes you think they are unlikely to last long after being removed from the sealed safe.

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a collection of small ornate boxes about the size of your palm. Each box contains a cylinder with patterns of tiny protrusions, adjacent to an array of metal tines of various lengths. You twist the small crank on the side of a box, it begins to plink out an Old World melody that probably hasn't been heard for centuries.\n\nThis will be a hit among my courtiers... a song for the ages!
Machinery!

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a complicated piece of Old World technology, the purpose of which is a mystery to you. The artifact features several prominent finely blown glass bubbles, mechanical innards, and thin flexible metal strands that shed greenish-black powder when disturbed.\n\nYou are unable to get the artifact to do anything. There seems to be something missing that you don't understand.
Firepower!

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a long metal tube with various bits of metal and brittle wood attached to it. You've heard stories that Old World knights used such devices to produce fire from nothing, but it's hard to believe you're seeing one for yourself.\n\nThough the safe has preserved it well, you will have to handle it gently and be unable to fix it if it breaks.

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a well preserved piece of Old World technology with the word "Underwood" written on it in gleaming gold-leaf letters. Rows of thumbnail-sized metal disks are attached to the complicated mechanical innards of the machine, each labeled with a unique rune.\n\nAside from its beauty as a piece of recovered tech, this machine would probably be very useful if you could figure out how to use and maintain it...

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a well preserved piece of Old World technology with the word "Arithmometer" engraved in the metal in a flowing script. The machine is dominated by a heavy horizontal metal cylinder, with numerals visible through gaps in the metal shell and a hefty metal hand-crank on the side.\n\nAside from its beauty as a piece of tech art, this machine would probably be very useful if you could figure out how to use and maintain it...

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a golden, palm-sized clamshell disk, attached to an intricate chain of gold. When you open the clamshell you see that one side is labelled with the numerals I through XII, and you realize that the artifact is an Old World timekeeping device.\n\nIt would be a stylish accessory for any lord, but it would be even more useful if you could understand its workings and restore its function.

You call for a houngan who serves the loa with both hands. Your guards restrain the prisoner while the bokor prepares a potion from pufferfish spines, datura blossoms, and other ingredients. The prisoner struggles at first, but the light soon goes out of [From.GetPossPronoun] eyes and [From.GetSubjectPronoun] enters a delirious, suggestible state.

A bokor has been summoned by your captor to crush your mind with a zombifying potion. You are restrained by the jailors and a foul liquid is forced down your throat. You enter a dreamlike state, and it's suddenly difficult to figure out what is real. You feel like you're watching yourself from outside your own body.
Loa gives military advice
Loa gives theological advice
Loa gives diplomatic advice
Loa gives administrative advice
Loa gives intrigue advice
The loa come to you in a dream, offering advice in exchange for your service. When you awake, you can still hear the voices of the loa and feel the lingering touch of the world beyond the Crossroads.
I will sacrifice a pig.
I will perform a rite.
My liege,\n\nI humbly invite you to attend the ceremony I will be hosting a few days time. This is a chance to serve the loa, receive their advice, and allow them to speak truths through you.
I will attend
I am too busy
The ceremony is a time when even a [Root.GetTitle] must serve the loa. How do you wish to do so?
Sustain the loa with an animal sacrifices.
Present offerings during a formal, serious rite.
Song, dance, and other merriments.

The loa have chosen to speak through others at the ceremony, but not you. Those lucky or pious enough to be possessed draw cheers from the revelers as they display the behavior and speak the words of the loa possessing them. You're not sure what you did wrong. Were your offerings not pleasing, or were you were simply not ready?
I can fake a brief possession.
There's always next time.
The loa have forsaken me.

As the voices of the other revelers rise around you, you feel a pleasant stirring of the spiritual world within yourself. The loa did not choose you as a vessel, but you did feel their presence. You make eye contact and share a significant moment with those around you, and you get the impression they felt the same thing.
We all felt the presence.

As the voices of the other revelers rise around you, you can feel one of the loa taking control. Your body seems to be moving on its own, and words that are not your own spill from your mouth. After a few minutes of possession, you are exhausted and drenched in sweat.
I am your vessel, loa!
Begone, spirit!
Angry loa disrupt your sleep at night and make it difficult to concentrate during the day. You can feel them always on the edge of your mind, watching and mocking you.
My gris-gris is powerful.
My gris-gris is potent.
My gris-gris is weak.
The wise loa possessing you has chosen to remain on the earthly side of the Crossroads. You can hear her even now, advising you to dedicate yourself to diligence, moderation, and study.
I will dedicate my life to study.
I wish to learn more.
The shrewd loa possessing you has chosen to remain on the earthly side of the Crossroads. You can hear him even now, inspiring you with words of greatness, wealth, and power.
The friendly loa possessing you has chosen to remain on the earthly side of the Crossroads. You can hear him even now, urging you towards kindness and respect for your fellow man.
My quill will write sweet words.
The gentle loa possessing you has chosen to remain on the earthly side of the Crossroads. You can hear her even now, counseling you to live a life of humility and serenity.
I will become a gardener.
The devious loa possessing you has chosen to remain on the earthly side of the Crossroads. You can hear him even now, goading you towards cunning schemes and clever plots.
I must understand the secret world.
The decadent loa possessing you has chosen to remain on the earthly side of the Crossroads. You can hear her even now, tempting you with erotic and worldly pleasures.
I will dedicate my life to pleasure.
The combative loa possessing you has chosen to remain on the earthly side of the Crossroads. You can hear him even now, bellowing for you to crush your enemies and expand your realm by force.
I must hone my combat skill.
The unhinged loa possessing you has chosen to remain on the earthly side of the Crossroads. You can hear him even now, chipping away at your sanity and gibbering in madness and terror.
Others must share my pain.

You suddenly realize that your loa possessor has returned through the Crossroads to the world of the invisible. For the last several days you have felt its presence less and less frequently, and for the moment your mind is solely yours.
The spirit departs
The spirit is enraged
Faustian Contest
This prideful character competed against a stranger in black with his or her soul on the line.
Fencing Expert

You are becoming renowned as a skilled fencer. You understand the subtleties of numerous fighting stances, and your artful parries and swift thrusts allow you to quickly declare victory in most bouts. Aspiring swordsmen come from miles around to challenge you and learn your techniques.\n\nIt is difficult not to boast about your fencing prowess.
I'm the best in the realm!
I only know that I know nothing.
Falconry Expert

You surely must be the finest falconer of anyone you know. You know exactly how to raise and train your birds to be perfect aerial hunters, and the sheen of their feathers and noble bearing is the envy of the land. Your birds promptly follow your command and nearly always return with desirable quarry.\n\nIt is difficult not to boast about your falconry prowess.
Archery Expert

Whether you're splitting arrows on a wooden target or bringing down a deer with a well-placed shot, few people can match your skill at archery. You can nock and loose an arrow from a powerful longbow in seconds, demonstrating the proper technique to your soldiers as you strike a target with pinpoint accuracy.\n\nIt is difficult not to boast about your archery prowess.
Carousing Expert

When it comes time to drink and be merry, no one seems to measure up to your capacity for alcohol consumption. You lead round after round of toasts when you throw a feast, but find that most of your court is unconscious before the night is half over. It seems like you could drink anyone under the table.\n\nIt is difficult not to boast about your enormous capacity for drink.
The Man in Black

You meet a man dressed all in black. With a mysterious smile he unrolls a piece of parchment and says, "I hear you fancy yourself quite the fencer. I happen to be a fencer too. I'd bet a sword of gold against your soul 'cause I think I'm better than you."
I'm the best there's ever been.
Sounds like a bad deal.
The vile machinations of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]!

You meet a man dressed all in black. With a mysterious smile he says, "I hear you fancy yourself quite the falconer. I happen to be a falconer too. I'd bet a glove of gold against your soul 'cause I think I'm better than you."

You meet a man dressed all in black. With a mysterious smile he says, "I hear you fancy yourself quite the archer. I happen to be an archer too. I'd bet a bow of gold against your soul 'cause I think I'm better than you."

You meet a man dressed all in black. With a mysterious smile he says, "I hear you fancy yourself quite the drinker. I happen to be a drinker too. I'd bet a cup of gold against your soul 'cause I think I'm better than you."
Victory!

You pull out all the stops as you cross blades with the man in black. He is one of the most skilled opponents you've ever faced, and deceptively strong and quick. As you parry a powerful thrust your blade sparks and leaves a whiff of otherworldly smoke. After several exhausting minutes of struggle, you get the better of your opponent and land several solid hits.\n\nThe man in black concedes and lays his golden sword at your feet.
I've shown him how it's done.
Defeat!

You pull out all the stops as you cross blades with the man in black. He is one of the most skilled opponents you've ever faced, and deceptively strong and quick. His blade seems to shed sparks and otherworldly smoke as it flashes towards you. You are distracted long enough for the thrust to find its mark and signal your defeat.\n\nThe man in black grins as you concede defeat, and hands you the piece of parchment you signed. "I'll be back to collect my winnings when the time comes."
Curse my arrogance!

You send your finest falcons and hawks out to catch birds and ground quarry for you, and they return with rabbits, squirrels, grouse, and a nice plump pheasant. The man in black's birds are of a type you've not seen before: piercing red eyes and feathers as black as pitch. The strange birds return with a hefty catch, but when all is said and done your catch is superior.\n\nThe man in black lays his golden falconry glove at your feet.

You send your finest falcons and hawks out to catch birds and ground quarry for you, and they return with rabbits, squirrels, and grouse. The man in black's birds are of a type you've not seen before: piercing red eyes and feathers as black as pitch. The strange birds return with a multitude of quarry, including a still-struggling wild turkey. As the contest draws to a close, you realize with despair that his catch exceeds yours.\n\nThe man in black grins as you concede defeat, and hands you the piece of parchment you signed. "I'll be back to collect my winnings when the time comes."

You and the man in black fire arrows at wooden targets placed at various distances. When he looses an arrow his bowstring seems to hiss and sizzle in addition to the normal twang, leaving behind a curl of pungent smoke. The man in black wasn't lying about his skill, and you both leave tight clusters near the bullseye. When the scores are totalled, you are relieved to see your score is slightly higher.\n\nThe man in black lays his golden bow at your feet.

You and the man in black fire arrows at wooden targets placed at various distances. When he looses an arrow his bowstring seems to hiss and sizzle in addition to the normal twang, leaving behind a curl of pungent smoke. The man in black wasn't lying about his skill, and he leaves tight clusters near the bullseye. Several of your shots are off the mark, and when the scores are totalled you realize with despair that you have lost.\n\nThe man in black grins as you concede defeat, and hands you the piece of parchment you signed. "I'll be back to collect my winnings when the time comes."

You pour cup after cup of wine and mead down your gullet, and the man in black does the same. He belches into an open candle flame, creating a puff of acrid smoke. His capacity seems the equal of yours, and after a few hours you are both having difficulty pouring the drinks. Eventually the man in black keels over, and you queasily declare victory. You take the golden cup from him, and stagger away to bed.\n\nIn the morning you awake with the cup in your hand, and the man in black is gone.

You pour cup after cup of wine and mead down your gullet, and the man in black does the same. He belches into an open candle flame, creating a puff of acrid smoke. The man in black seems less affected by the drink than you expected, and you soon realize you were foolish to make this wager. The last thing you remember is his wicked grin as you struggle to remain in your chair.\n\nYou awake with a splitting headache and the piece of parchment you signed.
The Contract

Rarely does a day go by where you don't think about the contract you foolishly signed with the man in black. Could there be some way to wriggle free from your obligation, or to protect yourself from the doom that surely awaits you in the afterlife?
I must live righteously.
I'll live like there's no tomorrow.
As you lay in bed, you see a man wearing black standing in the doorway. A wave of terror washes over you. Could it be that the time has come for him to collect his due?
No! It's too soon!

On [From.GetPossPronoun] deathbed, [From.GetFirstName] had some ominous last words. Though no one could determine exactly what [From.GetSubjectPronoun] was talking about, [From.GetSubjectPronoun] repeatedly muttered something about a contract and a debt owed to a stranger in black.
[From.GetSubjectPronounCap] is with [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] now.
I've assimilated the local culture.
column6: He asimilado la cultura local.

column2: Assimilate the local culture
column6: Asimilar la cultura local

column2: Do nothing
column6: No hacer nada

column2: Travellers in [Root.GetName] are often from nearby Christian lands. While you do not recognize the authority of [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] as they do, your faiths share a common history and have many similar rituals. Some controversial theologians claim that [Root.Owner.Religion.GetRandomGodName] will hear prayers from the devout of both faiths, but could it possibly be true?
In the name of [Root.Owner.Religion.GetRandomGodName], they are my brothers.
No. We are the pure and chosen few.

Many followers of El Santo choose to sharpen their martial skills in bouts of hand-to-hand combat, their faces concealed behind colorful masks. Will you choose to follow in the footsteps of El Santo, and prove your worthiness in the ring of honor?
I will take on all challengers!
My time is better spent elsewhere.
Lucha de Apuestas
Challenge another masked follower of El Santo to ritualized combat, wagering the unmasking of the loser.
Luchadore
This character hones his martial skill in masked, ritualized combat.

You survey the other masked warriors, but none of them have the noble bearing to be worthy of challenging. Though you are unable to test your mettle and courage today, you can take comfort in knowing you are unique in your skill.
I'll await a proper challenger.

You have found a masked foe worthy of wagering your own mask against. The winner will has the right to unmask and humiliate the loser, though victorious warriors sometimes choose to leave their opponent masked if the match is close.
I will issue a challenge.
Actually, he seems stronger than me.
Actually, he seems more skilled than I am.

Another disciple of El Santo has challenged you to a Lucha de Apuestas... a wager match. While the winner will have proved his martial prowess and piety in the ring, the loser is at risk of being publicly humiliated.
I accept the challenge!
Your opponent has accepted your challenge, and you arrange for the match to take place the next day. May El Santo grant you strength and skill in the ring...
Let the fight begin!
Your cowardly opponent has refused your challenge. Your skill in the ring seems to have scared him off, leaving you as the victor by default.
Let him shake in his boots.

You struggle with your opponent for what seems like hours, as your strength and skill are closely matched. Your exhausted foe makes a misstep, and you quickly move to take advantage of it. Moments later, tired and dripping sweat, you declare victory.
Let him feel the light of shame as I unmask him.
Wait, I recognize this fighter... I won't unmask him.
He fought well, let him keep his mask.

Your opponent is no match for you. You easily turn aside his attacks, and slam him into the ground repeatedly with your stylish technique. A more difficult challenge might have been nice, but at least you have won the match handily.
Unmasked
This character has been defeated in the ring, and unmasked for all to see.

After a hard-fought fight, your opponent has finally gotten the better of you. Exhausted and dripping with sweat, you collapse in defeat. As is his right, he chooses to remove your mask and reveal your face to the onlookers.
Oh, the shame of it!

You and your opponent test your martial skill against each other, finding yourselves closely matched. As the match wears on, your arms and legs begin to feel heavy and your opponent eventually takes advantage of your fatigue and downs you with a skillful slam. Despite your defeat, your opponent recognizes that the match was close and allows you to keep your mask.
A match against an equally skilled opponent gives you the best opportunity to improve your technique. In the aftermath of your victory, what will you focus on?
The adulation of the onlookers... and their gold.
Improving my martial prowess.
The veneration of El Santo.
You defeated your opponent so easily that there was barely any time to learn anything. Still, the onlookers were impressed by your technique and the fame of your masked alter ego has grown.
I must find a more worthy opponent.

You pull the mask from your defeated opponent's face, and reveal that he is [From.GetTitledFirstName]! He would probably be angry with you if he knew who you are, but for now your identity will remain a secret and all he can do is hang his head in shame.

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] has entered into the realm of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. As a follower of Santa Muerte, [From.GetPossPronoun] death leaves you with certain responsibilities. You are expected to be involved in the funeral rites, which will ensure safe passage of [From.GetPossPronoun] soul as well as protecting those left behind.
I swear vengeance on [From.GetPossPronoun] killer!
This option is available because you know who killed your [GetFromRelation], and Santa Muerte demands a life for a life.\n\n
Santa Muerte guides [From.GetPossPronoun] soul to heaven.
Santa Muerte protects and watches over all of us.
These rites are meaningless.
I will learn the rites.
This option is available because you are still a child.\n\n
Seeking Revenge
This character is focused on avenging the death of a close relative.

After hearing about the death of [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] at your hands, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has publicly sworn a vendetta against you. According to the rumors, [From.GetSubjectPronoun] will not rest until Santa Muerte snatches your life from you.
Mortal
This character refused or was denied the honor of being declared a living god. It will be much more difficult to rule over those who expect a king to be acknowledged as a divine avatar.
Incarnate
This character is widely recognized by people of the Mictlantec faith as a living god, or as the human vessel through which a god speaks.
The God-King

Mictlantec nobles and peasants alike chafe beneath the yoke of a mortal king. Why should they bend the knee to a fellow human, when the priests tell them gods walk the Earth? To rule effectively, you must be declared an Incarnate: the divine spirit of a god assuming human form, with a mandate to rule the mortal world in the Age of the Dead Sun.\n\nBloody human sacrifices, displays of skill and piety, and gifts to the priests should convince your subjects of your divine mandate. How will you establish your godhood, and avoid throwing the realm into turmoil?
My famed conquests and martial prowess.
My spiritual knowledge and renowned piety.
My father's divine blood.
This option is available because your father was an Incarnate and you possess a positive congenital trait.\n
I will make bloody sacrifices.
I am the divine made flesh.
I am not ready for the ceremony.
I am merely human.
I am not a skilled and prestigious warrior. I am not a pious and learned theologian. I was not born with obviously divine blood. My dungeons do not contain numerous potential sacrifices.\n
Postponed Incarnation
This character has postponed the ceremony to be acknowledged as a living god.
Prepare the prisoners for sacrifice.
Incarnation Ceremony

You mount the stairs to the sacred ziggurat, wrapped in the regalia of the gods and flanked on either side by a procession of high priests. Below you, thousands of your subjects have gathered to witness the ceremony.\n\nThe blood of your offerings will firmly establish a conduit between you and the gods. It also sustains and nourishes the gods, giving Mictlantecuhtli the strength to journey across the sky each day and return safely to the underworld... prolonging the duration of the Sixth Age.
Let the ceremony begin!
The Sacrifice

The altar at the top of the ziggurat is prepared for human sacrifice, sharp obsidian knives and other tools glinting in the sunlight. Now is the time to empty your dungeons and fill the stomachs of the gods with the blood of noble prisoners. Anointing your body with their blood will secure your position among the gods.\n\nYour loyal priests look to you with anticipation in their eyes, ready to retrieve the next sacrifice at your command.
Empty the dungeons!
The gods have eaten enough.
Day of Reckoning

You are dragged from the dungeons by men wearing extravagant cloaks of iridescent feathers and expressions of terrifying zeal. They escort you to a towering stone ziggurat, as you shield your eyes against the blinding sunlight.\n\n[From.GetTitledFirstName] is standing before a bloody stone altar at the top of the ziggurat, flanked by many men in feathered cloaks with bloody black knives in their hands. You may be meeting [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] sooner than anticipated.
Wicked servants of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName].
The Sacrifice

Your guards bring [From.GetTitledFirstName] up the stairs of the ziggurat. As [From.GetSubjectPronoun] is placed on the altar, you hear the mumblings of a [From.Religion.GetName] prayer to [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName].\n\nYour high priest looks to you, his skilled hands already stained with blood and gripping a ceremonial obsidian knife. With a nod from you, he will cut the heart from your offering.
The mighty blood of an emperor!
The potent blood of a king!
The strong blood of a duke!
The robust blood of a noble!
The blood of a human offering!
[From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] has heard your prayers.
I will show mercy in this case.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] is sacrificed to the gods!
Only a portion of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s blood will be taken.\n
The Ritual
The high priest plunges his wicked blade into your chest. You scream in agony, and you see nothing more.
The Ritual

The high priest cuts your skin with his razor-sharp blade of black glass. Blood pools below you as you scream in agony, but for some reason your life has been spared. Whether your physical wounds will heal remains to be seen, but you will surely carry this day with you until the end of your life.
Empty Dungeons

Your dungeons contain no notable prisoners for you to sacrifice. Hopefully your sacrifices have been sufficient to sustain the gods, please the priests, and sate the bloodlust of the crowd of onlookers.
A God Made Flesh
Royal Apotheosis
A God Walks the Earth

Your divine incarnation is clear to all. The high priest places a crown of obsidian and iridescent feathers upon your head. You raise your hands to the sky from atop the great ziggurat and the thousands of onlookers bearing witness to the ceremony kneel, then touch their foreheads to the ground.\n\nIt would be unwise claim yourself the Incarnate of Mictlantecuhtli, as even an uneducated peasant can see him in the sky every day. You can feel the divine inspiration of...
...Huitzilopochtli, the Dart-Hurler.
...Quetzalcoatl, the Wind Jewel.
...Tezcatlipoca, the Smoking Mirror.
...Xipe-Totec, the Flayed One.
the Dart Hurler
the Hummingbird
the Wind Jewel
of the Dawn Star
the Smoking Mirror
of the Near and Nigh
the Flayed One
the Night Drinker
the Mortal
Doubting the God-King

There are some who yet doubt the truth of your divine flesh. Perhaps your sacrifices were insufficient, and your words and deeds not pious enough to prove your Incarnation. There is still much that can be done to ensure your place among the gods.
Sizeable gifts to influential priests.
A bloody reign of terror against the doubters.
A Mortal King

Your sacrifices were paltry and your piety seems lacking. Nobles, priests, and gods alike are in agreement that you do not have the divine spark. Divinations show the future of the realm will be full of turmoil, as many of your subjects will consider you a false king.
Huitzilopochtli Incarnate

As the human incarnation of Huitzilopochtli, you must be skilled in all aspects of war. Huitzilopochtli requires a constant stream of human sacrifices to nourish him in his struggles against the forces of darkness that nearly destroyed him when he was the sun in the previous age. There are only a few who give their lives willingly to the gods, so you must seize captives with blade and dart.\n\nIn battle you wear a shimmering cloak of hummingbird feathers laid over golden cloth, and your face is painted pitch black.
My lifestyle must change.
My habits must change.
I truly embody the god.
Quetzalcoatl Incarnate

As the human incarnation of Quetzalcoatl, you must embody the great feathered serpent's vast knowledge and just rule. Unlike many other Mictlantec gods, Quetzalcoatl does not demand endless human sacrifices. As the "Morning Star", you must wake early each morning to greet the dawn.\n\nYour ceremonial garments are crafted from the resplendent feathers of the quetzal bird, which shimmer with iridescent beauty in the sunlight.
Tezcatlipoca Incarnate

As the human incarnation of Tezcatlipoca, you must be treated with the utmost respect and politeness. Those who anger Smoking Mirror are doomed to be destroyed with sorcery, their lives ending in chaos and strife. You rule the night, playing your enemies off each other with your skill in the art of divination.\n\nYour regalia includes a headdress adorned with heron feathers, a cloak crafted from a jaguar skin, and horizontal stripes of black and yellow across your face.
Xipe-Totec Incarnate

As the human incarnation of Xipe-Totec, you must maintain the cycle of death and rebirth. Just as maize sprang from the flayed skin of the Night Drinker many ages ago, you now coax a new living harvest from the dead Earth each year. The captives you sacrifice with arrows or gladiatorial combat provide succor to the Earth, ensuring that the cycle of renewal continues.\n\nYou wear the flayed skins of your sacrifices over golden armor, a terrible sight for your enemies to behold.
Sacrificial Ceremony

The gods require offerings of blood to sustain themselves. Should they receive insufficient sustenance, this age will end just as the last one did. Human blood is more potent than animal blood, and the blood of a king is more potent still.

Your weak mortal liege [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] brings shame to true followers of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. Your liege does not bear the divine blood expected of the position. This gives you the sacred right to cast [Root.GetObjectPronoun] down and take [Root.GetPossPronoun] place, in the name of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
I will exercise my divine right.
War is not the answer.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has fabricated a claim upon your primary title. Citing the lack of divine blood in your weak mortal body, [From.GetSubjectPronoun] conspired with traitorous priests to create the claim. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] has not yet taken any overt action against you, but that may change in time.
This treachery will not stand!

You are a true Southern Knight, and must uphold a chivalrous code: never back down from a righteous fight, be polite even to your enemies, and show fortitude in the face of adversity. You must do the right thing even when no one is looking, acting with integrity as though under the watchful gaze of your grandmother and [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
Kindness and hospitality.
Integrity and honesty.
Courage and honor.
Frankly, I don't give a damn.
Ancient Conveniences

Recently you spent some time reading a crumbling old book, slowly interpreting the writings of the Old World. Within its pages, you find descriptions of the miracles that enhanced the lives of the people of the Old World.

Invisible servants that carried spoken words hundreds of leagues in an instant? Even the swiftest pigeon takes hours or days.

Could their carriages really have been pulled by over two hundred horses? Perhaps the writer was exaggerating.

Summoning hot water on demand? That's a prospect anyone could get behind.
If only these luxuries were still around.
This sounds like blasphemous sorcery.
Diligent study will reveal their secrets.
Play Ball!

Between the spring planting and the fall harvest, the idle farmers of a peaceful realm amuse themselves with games of sport.

As you pass a village in your demesne, a group of local farmers face off against a travelling band of sportsmen in the ancient game of strikeball. The teams take turns attempting to strike a thrown leather ball with a heavy wooden cudgel, allowing their men to seize territory around the perimeter of the field.

A pleasurable way to pass the afternoon, even as a spectator... but a little wager might make it more interesting!
I'll watch, but I won't wager.
I support my local boys!
The travelling band looks a bit more skilled.
Lazy peasants need to get back to work!
You find out the results of the game...\n
It's an exciting game, and your chosen team jumps out to an early lead. By the end of the afternoon, they are ahead by several runs and you walk away with your pockets a bit heavier.
Your chosen team struggles to strike the ball anywhere other than the waiting hands of their opponents. By the end of the afternoon, your pockets are a bit lighter.
Holy cow! What a game!
Strikeball

You had such a great time at the recent strikeball game, that it gave you a wonderful idea: encouraging the activity across the realm! While it would be costly, it would provide a pleasant distraction from the sometimes dismal lives of your subjects.\n\nYour magnanimous generosity would reduce unrest among the common folk, and the physical exertion would maintain a supply of strong, healthy soldiers should the need for them arise.
Spare no expense!
Let them play ball!
No time for idle sport.
Idle Sport
The common folk have been encouraged to participate in idle games of sport, such as strikeball.
The American Dream

At court, a discussion of the old philosophers wends its way to the topic of the American Dream. Many writers who lived before the calamity wrote on the topic, though few of their profound works survive today.\n\nYour courtiers all have their own unique opinions on the subject. As the discussion winds down, one of them asks for your view. Many eyes turn to you with eager anticipation.
A life in service of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
To live a good and simple life, with family and friends.
To seize the lands of my enemies in glorious combat.
The dream is dashed... the old writers were fools.

The men of the Old World knew many secrets that were lost in the calamity. In the years since then, a society of scholars and philosophers in [Root.GetName] have gathered extant scraps of Old World knowledge for preservation and study. [Root.GetName] is a hub of commerce for geographic reasons, but these little-known archivists and intellectuals have quietly done their part to turn it into a cosmopolitan center of learning and culture.
Encourage similar study across the realm.
What can I learn from them?
They shall be rewarded for their work.
Pah! Useless bookworms.
All provinces in your realm gain the 'Temple Scholars' modifier. While this will speed the spread of advancements, it leaves fewer holy men available to take up the sword.\n
Temple Scholars
The clergy have been encouraged to study the secrets of the Old World. While this will speed the spread of advancements, it leaves fewer holy men available to take up the sword.
Ancient Warfare

There are many legends about the manner in which the people of the Old World waged war. It is common knowledge that they bargained with [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] to annihilate their foes from hundreds of miles away. Some claim that their champions penetrated the heavens on pillars of flame and smoke to steal celestial armaments. Others claim that they rode enormous clockwork tortoises into battle, crushing their foes under dozens of steel feet.\n\nIt is difficult to tell which of these tales are true, but what you know for sure is that a handful of the armaments of the Old World have survived. It would be good to wield that power... to feel the righteous wrath of the divine, warm in your hand.
I must acquire this power. No matter the cost.
You send agents out into the world to acquire an Old World firearm for you...\n

Vision of Wonder
A great fire roars in the center of the camp. Men and women from all tribes gather around it, embracing in fellowship with their faces smiling and shining in the firelight.
The night is dark, but the sky is clear and full of countless bright stars strung out like a great celestial road. Shimmering curtains of light bathe the land in beautiful, ghostly hues.
You are carried by the current of a vast river. You need not steer, the magic of the river guides you. You need not eat, the warmth of the Sun sustains you.
You walk through a waist-high field of golden grass. The grass parts as you pass, rippling in the breeze like the surface of a lake. You raise your hand to shield your eyes from the Sun.
Points of flickering orange light are kindled in the darkness. Soon, you cannot tell where the countless campfires end and the stars begin. You too must kindle a flame in the ashes of the old world.

One of the powers of the universe draws close to you, within the sacred circle. You are laid bare before its piercing gaze, enveloped by a feeling of strength, compassion, and connectedness with all things.
Vision of Nature
Three ravens lead you east, to the bank of the great sacred river. Three deer pass through the river valley. With them is a white fawn... a very great sign.

Each step seems lighter than the last, as you bound higher. You need not touch the ground to continue, the warm thermals carrying you ever higher. The people below are no more than ants, the vast forest like a blanket of moss.

You observe your prey, carefully readying your bow. You scrape your hoof against the earth, filling your mouth with shoots and tender leaves. You feel both the bowstring against your fingertips, and the sharp bite of the arrow in your flank.
A great beast watches you with glowing eyes, but you are not afraid. Its tongue lolls from its toothy mouth, and the beast almost seems to be smiling. Seemingly content, the beast departs.
Curtains of sunlight wash over you as you move swiftly between the trees. A footprint here, a drop of blood there... you must be getting close. A moment later, you see your quarry.
A massive bird takes flight, cleaving the clouds with each wingbeat. It wheels and turns in the sky, carrying lightning in its talons and producing thunder from the wind on its wings.
Deep in the forest you come upon a noble white horse with a single straight horn on its head. It turns to look at you and you feel a pleasurable sense of contentedness.
You chase a fox through the wilds, but it easily eludes you. You see it looking back at you with a mirthful expression.
Vision of Disaster
The sky cracks like chapped skin and splits with a deep groan of pain. Bloody rain drips from the heavens. Sick men wander aimlessly in the gory mud below.
Horsemen with flaming hooves rend the clouds with a clap of thunder and a burst of blinding light. Sheets of fire issue forth, scouring the land.
Thick mist creeps along the ground beneath a sky of patchwork colors. Your eyes sting and your throat is painfully parched. The only sound that breaks the silence is a distant gasping for breath.
The Sun is swallowed by a vast serpent of smoke. Dead, brown leaves swirl and settle in the chill calm of eternal night. The faint glow of a distant campfire is obscured by falling snow.
A man trudges across a blighted landscape of ash and dust. A boy follows close behind him. Nothing grows along the grim and desolate road.
You kneel down to drink from a pool of cold, placid water. Reflected in the water you see yourself, wearing a heavy golden crown.
You see a naked body, shivering and emaciated. [Root.GetSubjectPronounCap] turns to you with hollow eyes, a broken husk. You recognize your own face, withered with age and hardship.
Children laugh and play in a meadow of clover. The Sun is warm and the breeze is cool. Several of the children bear your face.

You swing your blade forcefully at your armored opponent, striking his neck. He is beheaded, and the strength of the blow knocks a shower of black lacquer chips loose from his armor. With a puff of smoke, your opponent's face is revealed to be yours.
There is a malevolent presence nearby. You feel like you are being watched, but you cannot see the watcher. You hear distant laughter.
Across the ragged sky, you see a vast herd of black-horned cattle driven by doomed and ghostly riders. One gaunt face turns and looks past you, your misdeeds pooling in his mournful eyes.
Vision of the Ancestors

A silent rider passes you on the trail, carrying a horn of glowing embers. The night is cold, but you feel a warm sense of kinship with him. You are sure that there will be a fire waiting for you up ahead, somewhere in all that dark.
You are in a vast city of the men of the Old World. Their homes are lit by a thousand thousand lanterns, stretching up into the sky. In comparison, the mightiest castle looks like a farmer's cottage.

You see an old dead city, the great ancient manors stained with the years. The roads are filled with the men and women of the city, a vast river of humanity in constant motion. The city seems to pulse, beating like a man's heart.
Your father is silhouetted against the Sun, smiling at you. Behind him stands his father, and yet more ancestors beyond him. You turn away from the Sun, and feel a strong hand on your shoulder.
Deep beneath the roots of the mountains, you have lived for aeons. Now you emerge from the darkness, squinting and peeking through your fingers at the blinding light. Praise the Sun!

The founder of Fort Bridger, mountain man Jim Bridger, is reviled in current Mormon canon for his defiance of the laws of God. Cultures farther to the west have a more favorable view of him, telling tales of him as a legendary and heroic trailblazer.

Nearby is the ominously-named Devil's Gate, a gorge carved by the Sweetwater River and reputed to be the final resting place for hundreds of unlucky travelers.

The Black Ships

Four enormous black-hulled greatships from a distant land far across the sea have broken the halcyon slumber of the Pacific, arriving off the coast of [From.GetName]. The foreigners initially speak of peace and amity, but soon make it clear that it is not peace that they desire.\n\nThe black ships disgorge thousands of demon-faced soldiers onto the docks, and they rush forth to seize the coast for their Undying Emperor!
Enough to make us lose sleep at night...

The Rising Sun

The ports of the Pacific have been opened for foreign trade by the demon-faced samurai. The black ships come and go freely from the newly established outpost, while those who resist submission to the Immortal Emperor across the ocean are put to the sword.
This day will live in infamy...
The Setting Sun

The black ships have been driven off and their demon-faced soldiers thrown back into the sea from whence they came. The officers of the black ships took their own lives rather than be captured. Perhaps one day your descendants will build their own black ships and make the reverse journey...
Victory!
The Russians Are Coming

Rumors from the coast far to the northwest say that an empire across the ocean has re-established the ancient city of Novoarkhangelsk, claiming to return it to its rightful owners centuries after their ancestors foolishly ceded Alaska to Old America.\n\nFleets of sleek wooden vessels with intricately carved octopus figureheads have been spotted moving down the coast. The ships drop their anchors at the port of [From.GetName] to unload thousands of soldiers wearing uniforms of black and red, and they promise to wield the wrath of the Monolith against anyone who does not submit.
Better dead than red!
Ura!
Red Dawn

The Novorusskiy invaders, aided by saboteurs and collaborators among the defenders, have established an outpost on the Pacific coast. Fierce resistance from small groups of armed locals did not turn back the invaders, and the surviving population will be re-educated until they conform with the new order. The foreigners are wasting no time constructing a sturdy wall to demarcate their holdings.
An iron curtain has descended...
Blue Dawn

The stalwart defenders of the Pacific coast have prevailed! The Novorusskiy army has been shattered. Their ships have abandoned the survivors and retreated back up the coast. The victory was costly, and a stone monument has been raised and inscribed with the names of the brave soldiers who fell defending their homeland.

Spurred by the tales of merchants from distant lands, many in Christendom believe that Rome is a desolate and uninhabited ruin. Centuries ago in a land far beyond the sea the city was obliterated by God's divine fire, and none dare to defy His will and return to the City of Ash. [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] encourages this understanding, as it lends credence to his claim to apostolic succession.\n\nAnd it shall remain eternally so.

These tales do not threaten the righteous order of New Rome, for they describe this false Pope as weak and beleaguered by infidels.\n\nIf this foreign Pope was the true apostolic successor the Lord would sweep away his enemies. That they remain reveal him to be an impostor.

May the Founders bless America!
I do solemnly swear...
Hail to the Chief!

For as long as have ruled here, we Brits have entrusted the raising of our children to Yankee nursemaids. Our first words would not be British but Yankee. As we grew up we learned to speak a tongue that was neither one nor the other. Now is this time to make this tongue our own so we may all communicate.
Yes let us be one with our serfs

Anyone want some apple pie?
Embrace Carpetbagger Culture
The ancestral tongue is spoken by ever fewer of our people, yet the old ways are not forgotten. We are something new - they call us 'Carpetbaggers'.

The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Yankee culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Carpetbaggers.
What will they think of next, I wonder?
Welcome into the fold, my Carpetbagger brothers and sisters!
Embrace Yanquito Culture
The ancestral tongue is spoken by ever fewer of our people, yet the old ways are not forgotten. We are something new - they call us 'Yanquitos'.

The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of American culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Yanquitos.
What will they think of next, I wonder?
Welcome into the fold, my Yanquito brothers and sisters!
Embrace Nuyorican Culture
Although we have retained the ancestral tongue, we are adopting more and more customs from the local population We are something new - they call us 'Nuyoricans'.

The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Boricua culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Nuyoricans.
What will they think of next, I wonder?
Welcome into the fold, my Nuyorican brothers and sisters!
You have reached adulthood, but you have not yet dedicated yourself to one of the three major schools of occult lore. Which school will you choose?
I choose masonic lore.

I choose diabolical lore.
Form Nouvelle-France

Centuries before the event, a great empire existed west of the Mississippi, known as Nouvelle-France. Now that the lower Mississippi River basin been united under a Francophone banner, we can reclaim the mantle of Nouvelle-France.
Vassalize the Palace Guard
With Mexico restored, the Palace Guard would willingly serve a sufficiently wealthy and pious Emperor.
Make Washington Capital
The city of Washington has seen better days, but no one can deny its symbolic power. If you so wish, you may restore it as the capital of America.
