column2: Pioneer Kings

Mormon Pilgrims to Zion suffer all manner of abuse and the routes are not safe. In order to protect the pilgrims and secure the holy cities for the Heavenly Father and the faithful, [Root.GetHerHis] Holiness, [Root.GetTitledName], has accepted the possibility of an outright invasion by joint Mormon forces. This signals a new era of large scale Mormon holy wars - the Expeditions.
God and Liberty!

Arizona - Mormonism's firm bulwark against the Atomicist infidels of the Southwest - is failing. The dire situation has convinced His Holiness, [Root.GetTitledName], to accept the possibility of an outright invasion by joint Mormon forces. This signals a new era of large scale Mormon holy wars - the Expeditions.

Salt Lake City, the very seat of the President himself, has fallen to infidels. In response, the President, His Holiness, [Root.GetTitledName], has declared his intention to forge a great alliance of Mormon lords in order to reclaim the eternal city. This signals a new era of large scale Mormon holy wars - the Expeditions.

The very heartlands of Mormonism are under siege by infidels! Desperate Mormon lords and ladies have persuaded His Holiness, [Root.GetTitledName], to declare his intention of forging a great and righteous alliance to expel the heathens in the name of the Angel Moroni. This signals a new era of large scale Mormon holy wars - the Expeditions.
The Mormon Expedition Era has Begun\n
The Wildfire Dies Down

Many years have passed since the publishing of the Westphalia Treatise. The wildfire of heresy has slowly burnt out, and most of the Emperor's vassals have now pledged to remain loyal to both the Emperor and his faith. The darkest days of the Reformation seem to have passed, and peace has begun to return to the Holy Columbian Confederacy.
As it should be.
Praise the Lord!
Cowards, the lot of them!
Have they finally stopped their bickering?
Collapse!

The empire of [From.GetBestName] is no more. After losing much of his predecessor's lands, the world no longer recognizes [From.GetFirstName]'s claim to imperial glory. The most powerful among [From.GetHerHis] nobles have already declared their independence.
And so it was...
Disintegration of the Caribbean Empire

The dream of a united Caribbean is over. When Marchioness Portia brought the lords and ladies of the islands under one banner, many believed it to be the start of a new era. \n Culture and sciences bloomed, while piracy declined and the imperial coffers were filled with treasure. With a strong and just empress, nothing could threaten the people of the Caribbean. Now, those days of stability are nothing but a distant memory. The rulers of the Caribbean have renounced their vows of loyalty, and the new emperor is not recognized beyond his own lands. \n The world is watching, as a fallen empire is ripe for conquest.
I sense an opportunity...
What will I do now?
Embrace the Twelve Tribes Mansion

You embrace the Twelve Tribes of Israel, a Rastafarian school of theology that emphasizes placing emphasis on equality and the connections between Rasta, Christianity, and Judaism. This will benefit research, but members of the opposing Bobo Ashanti mansion will disapprove.
Embrace the Bobo Ashanti Mansion

You embrace Bobo Ashanti, a Rastafarian school of theology that emphasizes tradition, ritual, and the uniqueness of the Rasta faith. This will increase your piety, but members of the opposing Twelve Tribes school will disapprove.
The Bell of Batoche

At long last, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has come home from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] quest to find a rare artifact. Bearing a large silver bell, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] appears before you and, bowing, motions towards it. 'My [Root.GetLordLady], I have searched far and wide, and have found you the Bell of Batoche!'

Examining the bell to sate your curiosity, you indeed find a small inscription reading "Vital-Justin Grandin, vque de St. Albert." Although this bell was thought to be lost forever, it has once again found its way into the hands of its rightful owners. And so long as it remains here, it will be sure to improve your co-religionists' disposition towards you.

Seemingly expecting for you to speak, [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits patiently before you.
The Stone of Golgotha

Followed by one of [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] men, who struggles to carry a large stone, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] long search. With a solemn look, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] gives a sign for the man to set down the stone.

'This is no ordinary stone, my [Root.GetLordLady]. I believe this is the actual stone upon which Christ himself was crucified.' Running your fingers over the surface, you come to agree with his assessment. You can even spot a few dark stains on its surface.

You start to think that [relic_hunter.GetFirstName]'s expression would change if you gave [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a reward..

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them a carefully wrapped silver box. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] tenderly unwraps the box and opens it to show a small piece of ancient wood within. It is a piece of the True Cross, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] explains!

[relic_hunter.GetIlElleCap] ouvre la boite pour en sortir un vieux et petit morceau de bois. C'est un morceau de la vraie croix, explique-t-[relic_hunter.GetIlElle]!

column2: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned carrying a large tome. Peering inside, I can spot some familiar words, and my [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] declares that this is none other than a genuine Gutenberg Bible!
The Constitution

At long last, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has come home from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] quest to find a rare artifact. Carefully holding a leather box, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] appears before you and, bowing, opens it in front of you it. 'My [Root.GetLordLady], I have searched for many moons, and I have found you the Constitution of the United States!'

Examining the parchment before you with excitement, you find that the text, although illegible, is unmistakably in the Founders' hand. As you blink rapidly, you remember the stories of the Constitution being destroyed in the Event... evidently, those stories were false. Once others hear of this discovery, you will surely be known until the end of time as a true American.

Seemingly expecting for you to speak, [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits patiently before you.
Betsy Ross's Flag

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] comes before you, proudly carrying a large, inspiring banner. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] does not need to speak for you to recognize it, for it has all the necessary signs allowing you to readily identify it as Betsy Ross's American Flag.

With it, you will not only be an inspiration to the men under your command, but also to the Americanist world as a whole. Holding it in your hands, you feel the connection to the Founders, and you know that your men will fight like eagles wherever it is seen.

As draw your gaze away from it, you see your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] is still standing there, waiting...

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has finally returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, and has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a life-sized portrait. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] ensures me that it depicts an ancient President, and that therefore it is most prestigious to possess it.

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has finally returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, and has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small iron box, containing a pair of curious-looking false teeth. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] informs me that they are the teeth of Washington himself, and that they were quite difficult to acquire.
The Platinum Chip

At long last, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has come home from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] quest to find a powerful artifact. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] reaches in [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] satchel and produces a small poker chip, which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] hands to you.

'This poker chip is composed entirely of platinum,' your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] says, 'and, if used in a game of chance, its owner shall never lose.' The significance of this find sinks in as you hold the chip and listen to your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle]'s words... If this chip truly is the Platinum Chip, then you will never again lose a gamble, whether that gamble involves coins, lives, or power...

After a short while you realize [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] is still waiting...

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a remarkable find! It is a genuine treasury bond, issued by the Holy Mint itself long before the Event that struck down America! This small piece of paper has within it the power of thousands, nay, tens of thousands of holy dollars.

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has finally returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, and has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a codex full of coins. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] informs me that each of those coins are incredibly old and rare, and that this codex is therefore worth far more than one might assume at first glance.
The Divine Egg

Having returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] artifact hunt, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] bears a large iron egg emblazoned with the holy trefoil.

'This is a divine egg, laid by Atomos himself in the days before the apocalypse', your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] says as you inspect the beautiful object. 'It must be, for it matches all depictions we have of such eggs.' Not only will the Atomicist world now surely look up to you, but you can henceforth threaten your enemies with the power of Atomos himself!

Your [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits as you gaze at the egg, clearly expecting a reward...
The Demon Core

Having returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] artifact hunt, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] slowly and carefully carries a series of metal blocks stacked on top of each other. Trembling slightly, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] sets it down in a corner of the room before coming forward to speak with you.

'That... that is the demon core.', your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] blurts out in fear. 'I know it is. I have seen it in action. I have met those affected by it. I... I apologize, but I had nothing else to bring...' Although the demon core is feared by Atomicists everywhere for its propensity to curse those it comes in contact with, you hope that you, at least, will remain safe form its effects.

[relic_hunter.GetFirstName] stares at you, waiting for you to speak...

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, carrying with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small box, within which lies an odd yellow substance. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] ensures me that this is an ancient isotope used by our forefathers to harness the power of the Atom! This will surely improve my standing in the Atomicist world.

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, carrying with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a strange-looking device that emits a crackling sound. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] ensures me that this is a Geiger counter, used by our forefathers to detect the presence of the Holy Atom! This will surely aid me in my religious duties.

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, carrying with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an ordinary-looking pre-Event timekeeping device. However, my [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] assures me that this watch is imbued with the power of the Holy Atom, and is capable of emitting light in the dark. If true, this would be a highly useful item.
Chest of Booty

At long last, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has come home from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] quest to find some valuable booty. Carrying a large wooden chest, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] appears before you and offers it to you. 'Aaargh, my [Root.GetLordLady]. I have sailed across the seven seas, and have found you a bounty worthy of Neptune himself!'

Opening the chest to sate your curiosity, you are blinded by the light coming from within, by riches beyond your wildest dreams. Properly protected from the elements, this chest has evaded discovery from greedy pirates for centuries... until now. Once news of this find spreads, you are sure that someone will compose a sea shanty about it.

Seemingly expecting for you to speak, [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits patiently before you.

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, carrying with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a piece of parchment. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] ensures me that this is in fact an ancient map written by a long-dead pirate to mark the spot where he buried his treasure! If only you knew where it was telling you to go...

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has returned from their long journey, bringing with them a carefully wrapped silver box. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] tenderly unwraps the box and opens it to show a small piece of ancient wood within. It is a piece of Queen Anne's Revenge, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] explains!

[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has finally returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, and has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small glass reliquary. Inside, one can clearly see a single hair, which my [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] claims is a hair from the beard of Blackbeard, himself!
The Maltese Falcon

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] search, followed by two men who carry a heavy, ornate gold box, which they place on the floor before you. Bowing, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] proclaims: 'My search is concluded. I have brought home with me the Maltese Falcon  a gift from the Knight Templars to the Pope.'

Opening the box, you find the Falcon wrapped in several layers of richly-decorated cloth. The Falcon itself is a beautiful statuette made of gold and studded with gems, sure to increase your standing in this world.

Pleased, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] waits for you to speak...
The Sword of the Emperor

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a beautiful sword. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it is one of Emperor Elton's swords, used in the conquest of Socal!\nNot only is it a finely-crafted blade, but it should also make men more eager to follow me in battle.\nSmiling as [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] sees the realization of the sword's significance creep onto your face, [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits patiently for you to speak.

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, carrying with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a finely-crafted idol. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] informs me that this idol depicts the deity America Kokudo Kunitama-no-Kami, the holy protector of the North American continent! This will surely improve my standing throughout the Pacific coast.

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, carrying with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small ruby slipper. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] doesn't even bother to speak - the item needs no introduction. It is one of the famed Ruby Slippers, capable of supernaturally transporting its owner to wherever their home is! This will surely improve my standing throughout the Empire of California.
The Heart of the Oasis

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, bearing a bizarre-looking object. Holding it delicately, and clearly treating the artifact with devout respect, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] hands it to you. 'I have found you the Heart of the Oasis, capable of healing any injury and curing any illness.'

Indeed, once you hold it is not hard to recognize it for the remarkable object that it is. Created by Gaia Herself during her first Reckoning, she who holds it is sure to have her favor!

Smiling as [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] sees the realization of the artifact's potential energy creep onto your face, [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits patiently for you to speak.
The Core of Methuselah

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, bearing an ordinary-looking piece of wood. Holding it delicately, and clearly treating the simple object with devout respect, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] hands it to you. 'I have found you the core of Methuselah, the oldest living thing on Gaia's green earth.'

Indeed, once you hold it is clear that this piece of wood is anything but ordinary. Surviving Gaia's Reckoning by her grace, the tree Methuselah was the oldest living thing on the planet even before the Event!

Smiling as [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] sees the realization of the object's ancient history creep onto your face, [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits patiently for you to speak.

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an intriguing piece of clothing. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] gives me a seemingly-ordinary crown of flowers, which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims has lasted for ages and has never so much as wilted!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small, ornate metal box. Within it lies an old piece of wood with strange markings etched on it... Surely this must be the core an an ancient redwood tree!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a strange crystal that shines with divine energy. You feel calmer and more tranquil just by looking at it... surely this must be a powerful healing crystal!
Sitting Bull's Rifle

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] what can only be a pre-Event rifle.\n[relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it once belonged to Sitting Bull himself, and that it was used during the Lakota nation's first war against the Americanists! Not only is it a precision-crafted firearm, it should also make men far more eager to follow me in battle.\nSmiling as [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] sees the realization of the rifle's firepower creep onto your face, [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits patiently for you to speak.
The Skull of Geronimo

Having returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] artifact hunt, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] slowly and carefully carries a metal box towards. Bowing, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] carefully opens it before you.

'This is the skull of Geronimo, taken by Americans in the days before the Event', your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] states proudly. 'I was presented with undeniable proof of that fact when I found it.' Although it would normally be considered incredibly disrespectful to carry a person's skull like this, the facts behind its disappearance mean that this skull has a special significance to its rightful owners.

[relic_hunter.GetFirstName] stares at you, waiting for you to speak...

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, carrying with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an ornate eagle feather headdress. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] ensures me that this was crafted by an ancient warrior in the days before the Event. This will surely improve my standing in the Native world.

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, carrying with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small box, within which lies a medicine cord. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] ensures me that this was crafted by an ancient medicine man in the days before the Event. This will surely improve my standing in the Native world.
Montezuma's Headdress

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an incredibly ancient and ornate headdress.\n[relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it once belonged to Montezuma himself, and that it was on the Emperor's head when he was first captured by the dreaded conquistadors! Not only is it a finely-crafted piece of headgear, it should also make men far more eager to follow me in battle.\nSmiling as [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] sees the realization of the rifle's firepower creep onto your face, [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits patiently for you to speak.

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, carrying with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a bizarre-looking skull made of crystal. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] ensures me that this skull is made entirely of a single piece of crystal, and that it once belonged to a god. This will surely improve my standing in Mesoamerica.

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, carrying with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an ancient codex. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] ensures me that this was created by the ancestors of the Nahua people long before the colonizers arrived in Mexico. This will surely improve my standing in Mesoamerica.

Ottawa

You have finally arrived in Ottawa! Situated on the border between Francophone and Anglophone Canada, the city prides itself on its ancient heritage, having once been the capital of a united Canada. As you walk down the street, hearing both Quebecois and Ontarian words in the air, you begin to imagine what it must have been like to live in that ancient Empire. You plan to visit the Shrine to the Unknown Solider, a site revered by all Canadians.
O Canada, we stand on guard for thee.

column2: You have finally arrived at Canterbury! It is beautifully situated between the St. John and St. Croix rivers in New Brunswick. The town itself and the surrounding woods are full of pilgrims from all over Canada. You had quite an eventful journey, meeting many strange pilgrims and hearing many strange stories, but you have finally checked into an inn near your destination. You are eager to finally see the Cathedral, one of the few great post-Event works of architecture.
I am full of devout homage.
Quebec City

You have finally arrived in Quebec City! As Cap-Diamant comes into view, you marvel at the ancient fortifications that surround it. Quebec was the first ever capital of Canada, and it was renewed and restored by the great Queen Veronique. You have not sorted out your accommodations yet, but you will try to get a room in the ancient Chteau Frontenac. Besides the Notre Dame Cathedral, the old Citadelle is a popular site for pilgrims.
I shall put God's gifts to good use.
Detroit

You have finally arrived in Detroit! Although the city has a horrible reputation, you have found that it is not quite as bad as many say. The great factories that surround the city are hotbeds for paganism, yes, but the Church of Ste. Anne de Dtroit is quite beautiful. The city's culture is unlike anything that can be found across the strait in Canada - people of all colors and creeds walk the streets as equals, and the you can almost always hear strange music from somewhere in the distance.
It has truly risen from the ashes.
New Orleans

You have finally arrived in New Orleans! Although the journey down the Mississippi River was long and grueling, it has been well worth it. The ancient French Quarter lives up to its reputation, and the Mardi Gras celebrations are unlike anything you have ever seen. You must visit Our Lady of Prompt Succor, as her intercession prevented New Orleans from falling into the hands of Perfidious Albion.
It is truly a unique city.

Panama City

You have finally arrived at Panama! Situated at the narrowest point between the Atlantic and Pacific oceans, Panama has long been a center of trade, and you can hear conversations in unknown tongues in almost any part of the city. Although not many truly Christian churches remain in the city, the golden altar at the Church of St. Joseph is still a sight to behold. Saved from a siege by the Brethren long before the Event, the golden altar still stands at St. Joseph's Church, a testament to the endurance of Christianity in uncertain times.
Panama! There is nothing like it!
San Salvador

You have finally arrived at San Salvador! San Salvador has always been a place where diverse faiths coexist, and this has only become more true since deluge. It contains not only the largest remaining Christian church in central America, but also prominent shrines to the Cult of Saints and the old Mesoamerican gods. As you see practicioners of all these faiths intermingle peacefully, you marvel at the sight. Still, you have come here on a holy pilgrimage, so you would be remiss to dwell on this too long. Iglesia Cristiana Josue awaits!
Truly, a capital of culture.
Belize

You have finally arrived at Belize! Like the Miskito Coast, Belize was once a possession of the ancient Crown, and as such holds a special significance to the Falling Star faith. The ancient Cathedral of St. John is one of the most important sites outside of the Miskito coast itself, as it was the cathedral in which many of the old Kings of Miskito were coronated. As you walk down the street, you can hear a tongue that is at once alien and distinctly familiar... truly, Belize is an incredibly holy place.
Truly, the land of the free.

San Salvador, what a fascinating place! A holy place for many religions, the city and surrounding area are full of monuments giving tribute to both Jesus and the Mesoamerican gods. Somehow when you look closer, they don't seem all that different. It really makes you think, doesn't it?
The Mesoamerican religions are most fascinating.
The Cult of Saints reveres Jesus too, does it not?

column2: While trying to run some Ivy League-related errands, you come across two undergraduates arguing loudly about something. Before you get the chance to hear what the argument is about, one of the students throws a punch at the other, and the argument turns into a fistfight. As a distinguished Ivy League scholar, you should probably intervene, but perhaps it is better to let them work things out themselves.
Beat some sense into them.
They will respect my authority!
Talk some sense into them.
Let them fight...

Hello, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

As you know, the Ivy League is not free. Although we do our best to make sure that our members are equipped with the best resources and equipment possible, we cannot do this for free. All members of the Ivy League are expected to donate a portion of their personal treasury to the League if able. If you have the funds, now would be a good time to donate. The envoy will arrive in around half a year.
In the name of Science!
Signed, [hermetic_collaborator.GetSocietyRank] [hermetic_collaborator.GetFirstName]
The time has come for me to donate to the Ivy League. [FromFrom.GetBestName] has arrived at my court, and has asked me to donate part of my treasury, as I promised to do some time ago..
Here is the money. Now go, in the name of Science!
I changed my mind. They won't get a single ducat from me!

Hello, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

As you know, the Ivy League maintains many libraries across the world, so that the knowledge of the past may be preserved faithfully. However, one of our libraries has come into disrepair. As a member of the Ivy League, it is your duty to restore this library so that it may live up to our standards and serve as a beacon of light and knowledge.
In the name of Science!
Signed, [hermetic_collaborator.GetSocietyRank] [hermetic_collaborator.GetFirstName]

The library is in dire need of books. Many older tomes have fallen apart, and more recent titles are missing altogether.\nThe question is, where to get them? And more importantly, how much will it cost me?
Science requires sacrifices, only the best will do!
Something from the bargain bin perhaps?
I know every book peddler in town.
This is hopeless.
Books don't go well with moisture, and the same could be said of older scholars. I need to make sure that the library's roof is impregnable! \nAlso, the latrines need attention. Badly.
We will need a metal roof! And a Franklin rod! And a brand-new latrine!
A proper stone roof will do. The latrine needs cleaning, though...
I bet that some undergraduates would be willing to do this for free...
This is pointless!

Relics from the pre-Event world surface from time to time. Including old printing presses. The Ivy League even has few of them in its vaults, but none of them are functional... \nWith lots of experimentation, and money, I could restore one to working order!\nOf course, I will have to replace some components that no longer exist with suitable alternatives.
A beast of brass, steel and type metal, powered by water-wheel and spitting pages... I can rebuild it!
I will have to pull some strings to get the money.
It's too risky, not to mention expensive. We should just stick with scribes.
Finally the library stands. And awaits judgment of the faculty.
They are amazed. Some even call me a genius!
They are grateful, and congratulate me on a job well done.
They are disappointed, and some even want to expel me!
